title: Authors and Citation
text: Audinga-Dea Hazewinkel. Author, maintainer. Tom Palmer. Author. Kate Tilling. Author. Kaitlin Wade. Author. Jack Bowden. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hazewinkel , Palmer T, Tilling K, Wade K, Bowden J (2022). tmsens: Sensitivity Analysis Using Trimmed Means Estimator. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/dea-hazewinkel/tmsens.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tmsens: Sensitivity Analysis Using the Trimmed Means Estimator},   author = {Audinga-Dea Hazewinkel and Tom Palmer and Kate Tilling and Kaitlin Wade and Jack Bowden},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/dea-hazewinkel/tmsens}, }

what: Sensitivity Analysis Using the Trimmed Means Estimator
title: Sensitivity Analysis Using the Trimmed Means Estimator
text: tmsens CRAN, can install R can install development version GitHub
code: install.packages("tmsens") # install.packages("remotes") # uncomment if remotes not installed remotes::install_github("dea-hazewinkel/tmsens")

what: Summarizing Trimmed Means Linear Model fits: — summary.tm
title: Summarizing Trimmed Means Linear Model fits: — summary.tm
text: summary method class "tm".

title: Summarizing Trimmed Means Linear Model fits: — summary.tm
Summarizing Trimmed Means Linear Model fits: — summary.tm
text: object object class "tm" ... user specified arguments

title: Summarizing Trimmed Means Linear Model fits: — summary.tm
text: summary.tm returns list summary statistics fitted trimmed means linear model object, components call matched call n number observations per treatment group dropout proportion dropout per treatment group trimfrac proportion data trimmed away per treatment group trimside specifies lower higher value trimming performed n_after_trimming number observations per treatment group trimming coefficients array coefficients corresponding p-values 95% confidence intervals Analysis_details reiterates trimming fraction side, , adjest=TRUE specifies adjustment performed comparator treatment group. SD_outcome array standard deviation per treatment group, observed outcomes trimmed outcomes

title: Summarizing Trimmed Means Linear Model fits: — summary.tm
code: set.seed(123456) test_dat <- as.data.frame(cbind(c(rep(0,500),rep(1,500)),                           c(sort(rnorm(500,0,1)),sort(rnorm(500,1,1.5))),                           rbinom(1000,2,0.4), rnorm(1000,0,1))) colnames(test_dat) <- c("TR", "Y", "U", "U2") test_dat$Y[1:200] <- NA tm_obj <- tm(formula= Y ~ TR + U + U2, GR = "TR", trF = 0.5,              side = "LOW", n_perm = 1000, adj_est = TRUE, data = test_dat) summary(tm_obj) #>  #> Call: #> tm(formula = Y ~ TR + U + U2, GR = "TR", trF = 0.5, side = "LOW",  #>     n_perm = 1000, adj_est = TRUE, data = test_dat) #>  #>  #> Analysis details: #> Treatment (1) group rescaled for adjusted TM estimate #>  #> Coefficients: #>        Estimate      Pval 95% CI LO 95% CI HI #> TR     1.354308  0.000000  1.177918     1.531 #> U     -0.071352  0.923000 -0.167223     0.025 #> U2     0.055791  0.047000 -0.008575     0.120 #> TRadj  0.969812  0.000000  0.840809     1.099 #>  #>  #> Dropout: #> 40% #>  #> Sample size after trimming: #> 250 #>  #> Trimming fraction:  #> 50% lower value trimming #>  coef(tm_obj) #>          Estimate  Pval    95% CI LO  95% CI HI #> TR     1.35430808 0.000  1.177917612 1.53069856 #> U     -0.07135247 0.923 -0.167223391 0.02451845 #> U2     0.05579053 0.047 -0.008575234 0.12015629 #> TRadj  0.96981237 0.000  0.840809363 1.09881537

what: Fitting Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm
title: Fitting Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm
text: tm performs trimmed means analysis data continuous outcome/response binary treatment/exposure variable. Outcomes sorted trimmed per treatment group, linear regression fitted using lm.

title: Fitting Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm
code: tm(   formula,   GR,   trF = NULL,   side = c("LOW", "HIGH"),   n_perm = 1000,   adj_est = FALSE,   data )

title: Fitting Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm
text: formula object class formula, specifying model, form outcome ~ terms, terms must include binary treatment variable, additional variables optional. GR string denoting name binary treatment variable. function assumes lowest value comparator/reference group trF number 0 1, specifying trimming fraction: proportion data trimmed away treatment group. trF equal greater largest observed dropout proportion. left unspecified, default trimming fraction 0.5 assumed. side specifies higher value trimming ("HIGH") lower value trimming ("LOW") performed. n_perm number permutations performed obtain p-value 95% confidence intervals estimates. Default 1000. adj_est logical. TRUE adjusted trimmed means estimate computed. default FALSE. data data frame containing variables model. data contain least following: numeric outcome variable binary treatment variable (numeric, character factor).

title: Fitting Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm
text: tm returns object class tm. function summary used obtain summary results. generic accessor function coefficients extracts regression coefficients corresponding p-values 95% confidence intervals. object class "tm" list containing following components: call matched call n number observations per treatment group dropout proportion dropout per treatment group trimfrac proportion data trimmed away per treatment group trimside specifies lower higher value trimming performed n_after_trimming number observations per treatment group trimming coefficients array coefficients corresponding p-values 95% confidence intervals Analysis_details reiterates trimming fraction side, , adjest=TRUE specifies adjustment performed comparator treatment group. SD_outcome array standard deviation per treatment group, observed outcomes trimmed outcomes

title: Fitting Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm
text: trimmed means estimate subject two assumptions: strong MNAR assumption requires dropouts (unobserved outcome values) located fraction distribution trimmed away; location shift assumption requires group variances full sample equal. adjusted trimmed means estimator relaxes latter, assumes normally distributed outcomes. adjustment performed group smallest dropout proportion. p-value 95% confidence intervals trimmed means estimate adjusted trimmed means estimate obtained permutation approach.

title: Fitting Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm
code: set.seed(123456) test_dat <- as.data.frame(cbind(c(rep(0, 500), rep(1, 500)),                           c(sort(rnorm(500, 0, 1)), sort(rnorm(500, 1, 1.5))),                           rbinom(1000, 2, 0.4), rnorm(1000, 0, 1))) colnames(test_dat) <- c("TR", "Y", "U", "U2") test_dat$Y[1:200] <- NA tm_obj <- tm(formula= Y ~ TR + U + U2,              GR = "TR", trF = 0.5, side = "LOW",              n_perm = 1000, adj_est = TRUE, data = test_dat) print(tm_obj) #>  #> Call: #> tm(formula = Y ~ TR + U + U2, GR = "TR", trF = 0.5, side = "LOW",  #>     n_perm = 1000, adj_est = TRUE, data = test_dat) #>  #> Coefficients: #>        Estimate      Pval 95% CI LO 95% CI HI #> TR     1.354308  0.000000  1.177918     1.531 #> U     -0.071352  0.923000 -0.167223     0.025 #> U2     0.055791  0.047000 -0.008575     0.120 #> TRadj  0.969812  0.000000  0.840809     1.099 #>  summary(tm_obj) #>  #> Call: #> tm(formula = Y ~ TR + U + U2, GR = "TR", trF = 0.5, side = "LOW",  #>     n_perm = 1000, adj_est = TRUE, data = test_dat) #>  #>  #> Analysis details: #> Treatment (1) group rescaled for adjusted TM estimate #>  #> Coefficients: #>        Estimate      Pval 95% CI LO 95% CI HI #> TR     1.354308  0.000000  1.177918     1.531 #> U     -0.071352  0.923000 -0.167223     0.025 #> U2     0.055791  0.047000 -0.008575     0.120 #> TRadj  0.969812  0.000000  0.840809     1.099 #>  #>  #> Dropout: #> 40% #>  #> Sample size after trimming: #> 250 #>  #> Trimming fraction:  #> 50% lower value trimming #>

what: Calculating Bias For Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm_bias
title: Calculating Bias For Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm_bias
text: tm_bias calculates bias bias-adjusted estimate trimmed means analysis (tm) given dataset, user-specified trimming fraction dropout spread. tm_bias calculates, assumption normally distributed outcomes, bias components resulting violation location shift assumption violation strong MNAR assumption.

title: Calculating Bias For Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm_bias
code: tm_bias(   formula,   GR,   trF,   side = c("LOW", "HIGH"),   spread_TG = "max_bias",   spread_CG = "max_bias",   data )

title: Calculating Bias For Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm_bias
text: formula object class formula, specifying model, form outcome ~ terms, terms must include binary treatment variable, additional variables optional. GR string denoting name binary treatment variable. function assumes lowest value comparator/reference group trF number 0 1, specifying trimming fraction: proportion data trimmed away treatment group. trF equal greater largest observed dropout proportion. left unspecified, default trimming fraction 0.5 assumed. side specifies higher value trimming ("HIGH") lower value trimming ("LOW") performed. spread_TG number 0 1, specifying dropout spread treatment group. spread_TG equal greater observed dropout proportion. left unspecified, worst-case scenario assumed, dropout located side distribution opposite one trimmed (spread_TG="max_bias"). spread_CG number 0 1, specifying dropout spread comparator group. spread_CG equal greater observed dropout proportion. left unspecified, worst-case scenario assumed, dropout located side distribution opposite one trimmed (spread_CG="max_bias"). data data frame containing variables model. data contain least following: numeric outcome variable binary treatment variable (numeric, character factor).

title: Calculating Bias For Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm_bias
text: tm_bias returns object class tm_bias. object class "tm_bias" list containing following components: call matched call bias_components array bias components, including location shift assumption bias (LS), Strong MNAR bias treatment group (TG) comparator group (CG) total_bias sum bias components TM_estimate trimmed means estimate treatment effect bias_adj_TM_estimate bias adjusted trimmed means estimate analysis_details user-specified trimming fraction, trimming side, dropout spread treatment (TG) comparator groups (CG) observed_TG_SD observed standard deviation treatment group (TG) outcome observed_CG_SD observed standard deviation comparator group (CG) outcome inferred_TG_SD inferred full sample standard deviation treatment group (TG) outcome max_bias_CG array bias components, total bias, bias adjusted estimate, inferred full sample group standard deviations, calculated assumption worst-case scenario dropout, dropout comparator group (CG) opposite side distribution one trimmed max_bias_TG array bias components, total bias, bias adjusted estimate, inferred full sample group standard deviations, calculated assumption worst-case scenario dropout, dropout treatment group (TG) opposite side distribution one trimmed

title: Calculating Bias For Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm_bias
text: trimmed means estimate subject two assumptions: strong MNAR assumption requires dropouts (unobserved outcome values) located fraction distribution trimmed away; location shift assumption requires group variances full sample equal. bias resulting violation either assumption can calculated assumption normally distributed outcomes. Obtaining strong MNAR assumption bias requires additional assumption distribution dropouts: assumed dropouts spread homogeneously across specified dropout spread. example, lower value trimming (side="LOW"), treatment group dropout spread 0.6 (spread_TG=0.6), value bottom 60% treatment group outcome distribution equally likely missing. specified dropout spread given treatment group implications unobserved full sample variance inferred observed data. example, observed dropout 0.4 assumed dropout spread 0.5, inferred full sample variance larger assumed dropout spread e.g., 0.8. addition calculating bias user-specified dropout spread, tm_bias also calculates maximal bias. example, lower value trimming (side="LOW"), worst-case scenario involve lower value dropout treatment group (TG) higher value dropout comparator group (CG), vice versa. Bias components calculated scenarios. dropout spread (spread_TG, spread_CG) left unspecified either treatment group, function return quantities.

title: Calculating Bias For Trimmed Mean Linear Models: — tm_bias
code: test_dat <- as.data.frame(cbind(c(rep(0,500),rep(1,500)), c(sort(rnorm(500,0,1)),sort(rnorm(500,1,1.5)))))  colnames(test_dat) <- c("TR", "Y")  test_dat$Y[which(test_dat$TR==0)[1:150]] <- NA test_dat$Y[which(test_dat$TR==1)[sample(seq(1,400),             200, replace=FALSE)]] <- NA  tm_bias_obj <- tm_bias(formula= Y ~ TR, "TR", trF=0.5,                        side="LOW", spread_TG=0.4,                        spread_CG=0.6, data=test_dat)  print(tm_bias_obj) #>  #> Call: #> tm_bias(formula = Y ~ TR, GR = "TR", trF = 0.5, side = "LOW",  #>     spread_TG = 0.4, spread_CG = 0.6, data = test_dat) #>  #> Analysis details: #>                                               #>  50% trimming,                                #>  under assumption of lower value dropout,     #>  with 40% dropout spread in the TG group (1), #>  and 60% dropout spread in the CG group (0)   #>  #> Bias components: #>   Bias type                 Bias    #>   LS                        1.44611 #>   Strong
